Charter school trustees from more than a dozen schools throughout New Jersey participated on Saturday in the Fourth Annual NJCSA Charter Board Institute. Through a number of presentations and panel discussions, trustees learned about recent developments in the charter school sector, changes in school law and regulation, the impact of the charter school movement on social justice, and strategies around communications, advocacy, and media. Perhaps most importantly, trustees had the opportunity to meet informally with their peers from other schools to share practices and compare notes.

It is a testament to the dedication of these individuals that they would dedicate a beautiful April Saturday to refining their board governance skills and enhancing their understanding of this essential work.
